characters: MOB SCENE FROM "THE HUNCHBACK OF NOTRE DAME"
MAKE PEOPLE SANE THE OLD FASHION WAY"
TRIEU GUYS FROM SAIGON LIQUORS, KEY'S KEYS
PERISCOPE SHOT OF SHORE LINE FROM WWII FILM
SCREAMING, PEOPLE YELLING "SHUT UP" OUT WINDOWS, GLASS
"THE RONALD REAGAN INSTITUTE OF SUPPLY-SIDE ECONOMICS AND
SPLIT SCREEN WITH WIFE AT HOME.
TED AND ELAINE IN A FIELD OF DAISIES
WIPE TO FULL SCREEN OF OVAL OFFICE
"THE GERALD FORD INSTITUTE FOR THE MENTALLY FEEBLE
"THEY SHOULDN'T HAVE GONE IN THE FIRST PLACE"
PERISCOPE SHOT OF THE ED SULLIVAN SHOW
SPLIT SCREEN OF KRUGER IN HIS OFFICE
POSTS" OVER A PHOTO OF TED AND ELAINE WAVING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A machete slashes INTO FRAME.  An American in battered fedora and leather jacket, accompanied by two gunbearers, hacks his way through dense bush.  We see him from the ba only.  He hacks an opening, bats fly out AT CAMERA and th bushes part, revealing huge overgrown stone letters -- th Mayan ruin look -- that spell "AIRPLANE II."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jupiter shuttle stands ready to fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Houston Control with appropriate jargon V.O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of a crowded modern terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All lunar departures, please proceed to concourse lounge 'B.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of heavy traffic at LAX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A number of men in futuristic-looking mining outfits, carrying futuristic gear, unload a truck with a corporate logo that reads:  TRX DEEP SPACE RESOURCE MANAGEMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention, all Pulsar Four mining personnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The miners look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please report to the Resource Expeditions office, level seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two miners head to terminal doors and pass FOUR NUNS, who bid farewell to FATHER O'FLANAGAN.  O'Flanagan shakes the hands of the first three elderly nuns, then grabs the las young gorgeous nun and kisses her passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No tongues, Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group tour moves through the room behind controllers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All lunar shuttle landings are handled by these computers and simulated on these video units.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at computer screen) You're programmed on R-two-niner and locked, Lunar eight six.  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three crew members watch the lit landing strip as their shuttle approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to co-pilot) It's out of our hands now, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CONTROLLER moves away from his video unit.  A kid fro the tour who has lagged behind hits a switch.  The screen turns into a video game with SFX.  He flips knobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew are tossed from side to side and try to regain control of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lunar shuttle careens towards the terminal, out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid is still playing like mad.  A flash appears on th screen.  SFX VIDEO GAME EXPLOSION and a corresponding EXPLOSION from outside.  SIRENS WAIL.  CONTROLLERS run around.  The kid is oblivious and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUD KRUGER, head of the space center, and the COMMISSIONE get out of a limo under a sign that reads, "MERCURY SHUTTLE."  They walk and talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commissioner, we both know the Mercury shuttle needs another month of pre-launch testing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.  The boys on the board want that shuttle to go on schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kruger and the Commissioner go up escalator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do the boys on the board know about safety, Commissioner?  Let me talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, get wise to the political realities. The boys on the board are under a lot of pressure from the boys downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kruger gets a pack of cigarettes from a machine. Commissioner buys a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll be the one they'll hang if there's a screw-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kruger and Commissioner get shoes shined.  A MAN next to them in white shoes reads paper with headline -- "SOLAR PLANT MELTDOWN, 500 WORKERS SERIOUSLY TANNED" -- and does notice his shoes are getting black polish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Bud, the boys downtown are under heavy fire from the boys in Washington. That's why they're putting pressure on the boys on the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kruger and Commissioner head down escalator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you tell the boys on the board to tell the boys downtown to let the boys in Washington know that the press has been nosing around my people in the front office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kruger and Commissioner head to their limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You handle your front office people, I'll handle the press and leave the boys in Washington to the boys downtown and the boys downtown to the boys on the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commissioner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop and look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish it was that simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get back in their limo and drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over P.A.) This is Mercury One control.  We have condition green.  Mark launch 'T' minus two hours and counting.  I repeat, we have condition green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed as a doctor and looking in a Controller's mouth. The Controller's face is bright green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This condition isn't as bad as it could be if it were a lot worse.  Take these pills. (hands him pills and water) Here's some water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two parts oxygen, one part hydrogen. It'll make the pills go down easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ANGLE LENS PANS the under-belly past the nose as if viewer bent his head back as far as he could, until... th CAMERA crashes to the ground as if it has fallen off the tripod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN workers on scaffolding who check gauges on exterior o ship.  PAN to panel that reads, "SOLID FUEL CHUTE" -- a sweaty muscular worker in undershirt opens the panel, fla shoot out.  LOOSEN to reveal another sweaty worker in undershirt shoveling coal into the chute.  PAN to other workers checking more gauges.  SUDDENLY a PANEL EXPLODES. Smoking, sparking wires pop out.  A WORKER runs up with walkie-talkie in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie) This is Mercury station six!  Get me the Sarg and fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON KURTZ and ELAINE THOMPSON get out of a taxi with ha luggage.  They are dressed in matching flight outfits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JAPANESE COUPLE get out of a taxi -- the man has about fifty cameras around his neck.  His wife hangs another camera on him.  He crashes to the ground under the weight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and Elaine are approached by a BUSINESSMAN with handful of roses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to buy a rose to help bail out Chrysler?  We're an all-profit organization and need all the money we can get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon hands the Businessman a dollar and takes a rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Businessman) Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Businessman joins six other BUSINESSMEN carrying sign with LEE IACCOCA's picture.  They all smile and chant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hari Krishna) IACCOCA, IACCOCA, IACCOCA, IARAMA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon hands Elaine the rose.  She takes his arm as they w towards the sign that reads, "MERCURY SHUTTLE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the best little computer officer on the Mercury mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would believe that Elaine Thompson was once a stewardess on the Denver-Chicago run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I can hardly believe that I'm engaged to someone like you, Simon.  I'm a very lucky woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man with a suitcase on a leash walks beside them.  The case pulls him along like a dog and takes a leak on a pos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women and the space program have come a long way, sweetheart.  But after the wedding, no more complicated computers for my little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, darling, they've offered me a chance to head up the computer analysis division for the Jupiter probe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're heading up the division in charge of babies for Mr. and Mrs. Simon Kurtz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses Elaine and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's an order, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man with the case on a leash passes a woman with a ca on a leash.  The cases start a violent, BARKING DOG FIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARG (imagine George Kennedy), dressed in a tuxedo, tie undone, with a huge cigar, which he eats during the conversation, talks to his wife on his car phone.  A work in hard hat waits next to him.  Behind the worker are fue drums and a large sign that reads:  DANGER, FUEL -- ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING, ABSOLUTELY NO SPITTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on car phone) Marge, you better go without me.  We've got a condition red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in evening gown, a cigar stuck in her mouth) We've got a condition red with our marriage.  I think you're in love with that shuttle, not with me.  I want a divorce, Sarg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarg lights his cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there someone else, Marge?  Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarg throws the lit match towards the "ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING" sign.  The worker grimaces but nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarg, there's been someone else for fifteen years.  You were just too involved in your work to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hang up.  Sarg bites off the end of his cigar and sp it in the direction of the "NO SPITTING" sign, blowing th worker OUT OF FRAME with a MASSIVE EXPLOSION.  Sarg hops into his car, takes a Lava lamp from the seat and puts it the car roof -- like Kojak's flasher.  The lamp flashes, SIREN WAILS, as Sarg pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks about his wife.  SPLIT SCREEN FLASHBACK OF THEI BEDROOM.  Marge, a cigar in her mouth, is in bed with fiv football players -- other half-clad athletes (hockey, baseball, wrestling, basketball) line up for their turn a her.  Sarg has to climb over them to kiss her goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wait up for me, sweetheart.  We're testing the retro-rockets tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just can't see it, can you, Sarg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll talk tomorrow, hon.  I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WILSON FAMILY -- JOHN, ALICE and ten-year-old JIMMY - carry luggage.  Jimmy carries a puppy in a small cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Mercury passengers please proceed to passenger processing, concourse level 'C.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy Wilson looks at Scraps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will Scraps be able to sit with us, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to check, Jimmy.  It's a pretty long trip to Mercury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PORTER approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you folks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing him a bag) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing Scraps) Is that your puppy, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, his name is Scraps and he's going to Mercury with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No dogs are allowed on the shuttle, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling out a handgun) Scraps will have to be shot.  I can do it for you here if you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SHOOTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraps!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Just joking.  Blanks.  See, Scraps is fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, John, and Porter crack up while Jimmy cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just a joke, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and John look at each other as if there is somethin wrong with their son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man lifts a large dog cage out of the trunk of a taxi. Inside is another man dressed in S&M leathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Man in Cage) If we can't fit you under the seat, you'll just have to be locked up with the luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man in the cage seems to relish the latter suggestion Two Porters lift the cage onto a conveyor belt next to Jimmy's dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarg stands beside the burnt panel on the side of the shuttle.  He is eating another cigar, holding a burnt wir and talking into a walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way this wiring could have passed inspection without Simon Kurtz's okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Just patch up the damage and get that ship ready to fly.  That's an order, mister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got it, mister.  But you can tell your boys on the board for me that this thing stinks to high heaven of kickback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kruger turns to room.  LOOSEN to reveal a dozen five-year old boys in three-piece suits, smoking cigars.  A huge Keans-style painting of three astronauts with big eyes, painted on black velvet, hangs in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard it, boys.  Now, what do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarg looks at the wire and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to worker) Ted Striker was right six months ago when he test-piloted this sucker.  And what did he get for telling the truth?  A one-way ticket to Palukaville.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarg spits a chunk of cigar on the ground, blowing the worker OUT OF FRAME with a MASSIVE EXPLOSION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jet fighter streaks across the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TED STRIKER is at the controls.  His oxygen mask hangs lo from his helmet.  Clouds outside shoot by -- he's going a least 700 MPH.  A bird lands on the nose in front of the window.  Ted shoos it away by knocking on the glass.  He takes a slug of beer and cockily pulls on the stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane does a barrel roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted has beer all over his face and shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker's fighter comes in for a landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP of sign, "WELCOME TO RIO MONTENEGRO -- POP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COME UP on CLOSEUP of parachute.  PAN past a flight jacke thrown over a chair, clothes strewn around, a framed phot of TED and ELAINE on the bedtable next to a bottle of whiskey.  The room is hot and dusty.  Ted lies on the bed soaked with sweat, a drink in his hand, a cigarette dangl from his lip.  He takes a drink and, forgetting to remove the cigarette, swallows it without batting an eye.  LOOSE to find a CRUCIFIX above the bed with a real person on it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self) Who could have figured it would come to this.  It'll be twenty years this week that I lost my entire squadron over Macho Grande.  Planes, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too low, Striker!  You're too low!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crucifix in b.g. looks around trying to figure out wh the planes in the SUPER are coming from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the war, I couldn't go near anything with a pair of wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pigeon lands on the Cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is, until fate dropped me on the seat of my pants at the stick of a 167 into Chicago with no crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's funny how fate can make heroes out of cowards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crucifix gives a look of exasperated boredom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER:  NEW YORK TIMES HEADLINE, "STRIKER SAVES l20!" OVE PHOTO OF TED AND ELAINE WAVING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then came the job offers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The publicity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even the key to the City of New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted wipes the sweat off his face and switches on the tabl fan.  A tornado force wind destroys the room as he fights switch off the fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A peasant boy takes a newspaper from a newsstand.  The headline reads, "MERCURY SHUTTLE FLIES TOMORROW."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senor Ted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy hightails it through the town-square and passes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A large alabaster statue of the Generalissimo snorting cocaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Soldiers dragging nuns off screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Nuns dragging soldiers off screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes a line of peasants held at gunpoint by soldiers We HOLD on them.  In b.g. are stores like HITLER'S SHOES,

dialogues.speaker: TRIEU GUYS FROM SAIGON LIQUORS, KEY'S KEYS
dialogues.text: stands in doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to first peasant) Traficante de drugas o communista?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER:  SUBTITLES -- "Drug dealer or communist?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading) Traficante de drugas, traficante de drugas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER:  SUBTITLES -- "Drug dealer, drug dealer!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier lets the peasant go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to second peasant) Traficante de drugas o communista?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER:  SUBTITLES -- "Drug dealer or communist?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The peasant panics and bolts from the line.  The soldiers FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Communista!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs up to THE HOTEL MONTENEGRO.  A sign reads, "TV, POOL, WATERBEDS, DONKEY, KLEENEX" -- All but "KLEENEX" ar crossed out.  He runs inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clean-cut AMERICAN COUPLE argue with Desk Clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Desk Clerk) We've lost all our travelers' checks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down.  What kind were they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: American Excess!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Clerk throws up his hands and strikes the same pose a the Karl Marden look-alike in the "AMERICAN EXCESS" poste b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say you're fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy passes them and bounds up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP of Ted pacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self) Next thing I know, I'm the chief test pilot for the XR-2300, NASA's first Mercury shuttle.  That is, until I report she's got more flaws than the Titanic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOSEN slowly to find the Cross empty and the man who was it hanging, his feet dangling next to Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm testing old F-l8s for some crazy Generalissimo who thinks there's a commie behind every tree in the Amazon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY the boy bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senor Ted!  Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted spins and the paper stays still.  He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God!  They're launching the ZR-2300. Do you know what that is, Jose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The muffler bracket for a '78 Pinto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's an XR-2200.  The XR-2300 is the Mercury shuttle.  They can't do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted races out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taxi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted jumps into the taxi on bottom of pile.  The driver POUNDS on his HORN -- it CONTINUES TO BLARE as they pull away, dragging other taxis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Houston, Texas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Houston, Texas, senor??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right at the corner, left at the light. Here's a map and step on it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted throws a map onto the floor of the front seat.  The driver steps on the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old truck loaded high with furniture pulls up.  A YOUN MAN and his PARENTS, looking like the family from THE GRA OF WRATH, get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We finally made it, Ma.  Mercury.  We're gonna start all over agin.  A whole new life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the soil is rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bends down and takes a handful of earth from the termi sidewalk and lets it run through his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the union strong.  Where men are free to realize their true potential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black PORTER approaches and grabs a bag at the bottom o their pile of junk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where black men and white men, working together, can move mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porter pulls the bag and the entire mountain of junk cascades to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is covered in mud, flames shoot out from under the hoo the HORN BLARES.  The driver flips off the meter which reads, "874,567,004,500,000,000."  The numbers run off th meter along a special attachment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be eight hundred and seventy-four zillion quastavitas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's three bucks.  Keep the change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STELLA BARRINGTON pushes her wheelchair-ridden father, DR CYRUS BARRINGTON, through the terminal crowd.  A PORTER approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You folks need any help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, but we have a terrific woman in on Thursdays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, isn't that Dr. Barrington, the world- renowned agronomist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a privilege to meet you, sir, I'm familiar with all your work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, Daddy.  We have to check in. (to Porter) He was never appreciated at the Institute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes, the Institute, I'm familiar with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he's D-Y-I-N-Ging and wants to be buried on Mercury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella pushes her father away as another PORTER approache our first Porter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, wasn't that Dr. Barrington, the world-renowned agronomist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  Are you familiar with his work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but the missus sure is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The departures side reads.  "MERCURY SHUTTLE - DEPARTS 6:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self) I have to stop that flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted pushes his way through the crowd past two businessmen HOLD on them as BUSINESSMAN 1 straightens BUSINESSMAN 2's tie and hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about the Viatex account. It's a buy-sell option.  We can't get hurt in either case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep on top of their legal people, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sweat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss and part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to traveller) We can take your in-flight dinner orders here, if you like.  Today there's lobster or rack of lamb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobster sounds nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agent throws a huge lobster into a steaming cauldron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rushing up) Where can I find mission control?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without pointing or indicating in any way) Information's over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems a bit puzzled but moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted passes travellers in rags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to traveller in rags) Today there's the swill or the slop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slop sounds nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted passes the "NO CLASS" line.  Travellers in line all w gaudy double-knit suits, white belts and shoes, carry lav lamps and bongo drums, wear alpine hats, etc.  The agent hands a NO CLASS traveller his ticket with large foam dic dangling.  Ted spots the INFORMATION counter and heads fo it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Info Agent) What's the fastest animal on earth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cheetah.  Next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I fake my orgasms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next in line are three armed, bearded "TERRORISTS."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, where is flight to Miami?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without indicating anything) Over there.  Next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TERRORISTS leave looking confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mission control?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without indicating anything) It's over therrrrrrr!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agent is shot with an arrow and slumps over the count

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks in the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's strange.  I just came from over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, Simon, and FRANK MORGAN, the shuttle pilot, talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll meet you on board.  I've got some business to attend to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Elaine) Frank's the best pilot in the program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so excited, Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess this is a first for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I've been excited before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning around) Te...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not important now, Elaine.  We have to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon pulls Elaine away.  They all walk and talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, we've been worried sick ever since you escaped from the Ronald Reagan Institute For The Mentally Feeble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk faster.  The b.g. starts whipping by as if they running.  Wind blows in their hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you on the Mercury mission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Striker.  And we're getting married when we return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The b.g. moves faster.  The wind gets stronger.  They pas marathon refreshment stand and are handed wet sponges and cups of Gatoraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got to be stopped!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Ted, the invitations have already gone out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean the Mercury flight.  It's not safe and, Kurtz, you know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still crazy, Striker.  Come on, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon pulls Elaine away as she looks back with empathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did Ted mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave Ted standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, he's still sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind is still blowing in his hair even though he stan still.  Ted has a FLASHBACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, in flight coveralls, follows after Simon who is overseeing the operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're seeing bugs where they don't exist, Striker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding wire) Look at this wiring.  It's shorting out under high temperatures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're tired, Striker, overworked.  That wiring meets all the safety specifications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you've been subtly spreading the word that I'm having a breakdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NEWSPAPER BOY passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shuttle test pilot goes mad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TECHNICIAN -- JACOBS -- enters with drawings of flight outfits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, these are the designs for the flight uniforms.  I think the captain's is to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with drawings) Good, good, no, no, good.  What's this?! I said no studded dog collars, Jacobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacobs grabs the drawings and leaves in a huff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't get away with this, Simon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted turns to leave and bumps right into Elaine.  She hold him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling away from her) Ask Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In b.g. a car is parked by a huge rocket engine.  A worke opens the hood and strings jumper cables to the rocket. sign above rocket reads, "ROCKET ENGINE TEST AREA."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, you're overworked.  You've been flying yourself into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing wrong with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's relax tonight, just the two of us. I'll make a quiet Italian dinner just the way you like it, with spaghetti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're as bad as the rest of them, Elaine! (ranting) It's all here in the design specifications! (grabs plans from a passing technician) Look!  It's all here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon signals the guards.  They grab Ted.  He struggles a rants.  A DOCTOR in white approaches and injects somethin into Ted's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Wait!  You're hurting him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted falls unconscious.  Simon holds Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine!  Ted's a danger to himself, he's a threat to this mission and his behavior does absolutely nothing to promote peace in the Middle East.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying on Simon's shoulder) Simon, why has he become so... so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So mentally ill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine collapses on Simon's shoulder, sobbing.  Simon smi evilly.  The technician with the jumper cables, b.g., signals the driver to start the car.  The car revs and th rocket fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted still standing alone and muttering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self) I'm perfectly sane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted notices Stella Barrington looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, are you alright?  I noticed you talking to yourself.  I'm a nurse.  Can I be of some help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... oh, thank you.  It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to thank me, I'm a nurse. This is my father, Dr. Barrington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Dr. Barrington, the world renowned agronomist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  He's dying a-n-d wants to be buried on Mercury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm familiar with your work, Doctor. You'll have to excuse me, I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to excuse yourself.  I'm a nurse.  I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me onboard, sweetheart.  I have to pick up a few things at the drugstore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking her watch) Don't be too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon walks into the drugstore past a DRUGGIST who whispe to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uppers, downers, coke, speed, hash, Tampax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted approaches.  We see light flashes from a 25Вў photo booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, please.  You're just making things difficult for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN IN BLACK GARTER BELT emerges from photo booth followed by a donkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, what happened to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, I loved you and I'll always love you. But I need Simon.  He's stable.  He's a good provider.  I want that at this stage of the game, Ted.  He might have his faults, but Simon doesn't know the meaning of the word fear and I need that in a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Druggist hands Simon a huge bottle of pills.  The lab reads, "ANTI-FEAR PILLS."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the label, "ANTI-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does this word mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at label) 'Fear,' to be afraid or over-anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon swallows a handful of pills, braces himself and wal out right through the plate glass window without feeling thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted is still following Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, someone has to listen to me.  I'm going right to mission control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A kid bops by with a huge (5'x3'x2') oak cabinet, TV/ster console perched on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, you should go right back to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine leaves and Ted has another FLASHBACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN by dorm window.  We see a sign on grounds outside --

dialogues.speaker: "THE RONALD REAGAN INSTITUTE OF SUPPLY-SIDE ECONOMICS AND
dialogues.text: HOSPITAL FOR THE CRIMINALLY INSANE."  PAN patient in bed, accountant at desk, patient in bed, accountant at desk, T in bed.  Ted has electrodes attached to his head.  A NURS with "I (heart) NORMAL" on the back of her uniform, hands Ted some pills.  He is about to pop them when she stops h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's $38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted hands her bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOSEN to find Elaine on other side of bed.  She turns of the radio and opens a box of spaghetti-to-go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat this spaghetti, Ted.  It'll make you feel a lot better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that, Ted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy Davis Junior.  Terrible car accident.  He hasn't been the same since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white patient in lots of gold chains.  A Nurse stands o him and pulls a long oil dip-stick from his mouth, checks it, wipes it off and replaces it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, when are you going to realize Simon Kurtz put me in here to get me out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when are you going to realize, Ted, that your mental hygiene is the most important thing right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ranting) It works... No, it doesn't... Yes, it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On BEARDED MAN in rags chained to wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does work... No, it doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Ted and Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's David Stockman.  He's been here twenty years, that's all he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, you must remember what the doctor said, the first step on the road to sanity is admitting that you're sick.  Now take your electro-shock and you'll be back at the space center in no time.  And by the way, Ted, I'm leaving you for Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted gags on his spaghetti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't go on living with a man who refuses to deal with reality, Ted.  I have to go now.  Believe me, it's best for all concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine leans over to kiss Ted.  He turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No goodbyes, Elaine.  Just go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's the way you want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the way I want it.  Just turn the radio on and go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Ted.  I don't want to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine flips a switch by the bed thinking it's the radio. It's the "ELECTRO-SHOCK."  Ted goes into convulsions as s leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rubs his temples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Morgan kisses JANE DENNIS, his mistress.  In b.g. i bookstore window with a display of yellow covered books w plain black titles and a sign advertising, "NO-NAME BOOKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visible titles include:  "DEEP BOOK," "FASCINATING BOOK," "THE WORLD ACCORDING TO JOHN DOE."  A man next to the win reads a newspaper with headline, "SENSELESS MURDER UP 99%

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol's not going to give me a divorce that easily, Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about her, Frank.  She could do something senseless, something violent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who's not making sense, Jane.  Carol's not the violent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sees CAROL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol whips out a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  This is senseless!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRES.  Jane faints.  Other women nearby faint.  Two S.W.A.T. cops faint.  Carol bolts.  The newspaper, b.g., clicks over from 99% to 120%.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted pushes through crowd and passes a spherical booth wit sign that reads, "ORGASMIC EXPERIENCES, 25Вў."  MRS. GOOC an elderly woman, stops Ted next to the booth door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young man, would you have change for a twenty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going for his wallet) I might have two tens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you anyway, but I wanted it in quarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted keeps moving past a police line which has gone up aro Frank Morgan's body.  We HOLD on the murder scene.  A DETECTIVE kneels beside the body which now has a chalk ma around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lookind down at Detective) When is this senseless killing going to stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senseless or not, Sergeant, there's a pattern here.  This is the 12th victim this week with a chalk mark around the body.  I want this whole area cordoned off!  I want everyone in this terminal booked and beaten until they talk.  I want an M.O. on everyone who has seen THE SOUND OF MUSIC and I want the entire population of Hawaii off that rock and into the water within one hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallick stands up and finds the area surrounded by 30 accordian players playing "Lady of Spain."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant.  I said cordon off, not accordian off!  Now dust this area for prints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One cop pulls out a duster and dusts the wall.  Other cop follow after him hanging prints by Picasso, Lautrec, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And run a check on their plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop looks at people's upper false teeth plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will this senseless killing end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICE PHOTOGRAPHER straddles the body and shoots it "BLOW-UP" style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super!  Great!  Super!  Terrific!  Super!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Commissioner.  Senselessly murdered just minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That just doesn't make any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder how your boys in Washington are going to take this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, leave the boys in Washington to the boys downtown and the boys down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've made your point, Commissioner. There's only one other pilot who can handle that shuttle and that's Clarence Oveur.  He's got a lunar flight today.  I want him pulled. (to Jacobs) Jacobs, pull Oveur!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in your size, but I have a cardigan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll trust you on this, Bud, but I'm a little nervous about Oveur's record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commissioner throws an album on Kruger's desk.  On th cover is a photo of Oveur with an accordian.  The title reads, "CLARENCE OVEUR'S 400 POLKA FAVORITES."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN OVEUR buys flight insurance from a machine.  Simo approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Oveur?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Kurtz, I presume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have much time.  Let's move. I'll explain everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk away past the Transcendental Air counter.  Two HARI KRISHNA AGENTS smile at customers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chanting or non-chanting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN along Controllers at their monitors.  Monitors show t shuttle on gantry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mercury launch control at "T" minus fifty-eight minutes and counting. All systems are go.  Clear launch area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rise and start clearing their dishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on P.A.) I said 'launch' not 'lunch'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The workers sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oveur and Simon hurry along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how dry cleaning works.  Now I'd like to quickly go over the digestive system of amphibians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it's necessary to explain everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon spots Ted getting directions from a security guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll meet you on board.  There's something I have to take care of first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted rushes in and up to the RECEPTIONIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to see Bud Kruger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have an appointment, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, dammit.  It's a matter of life or death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to be more specific than that, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, it's a matter of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking her book) Death, death.  How about the first Thursday in March, ten o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted bolts by her and grabs a door knob on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to stop me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's not a door.  The door's over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't indiciate direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOOM to CLOSEUP of Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's strange.  I just came from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Ted falls unconscious into the arms of two guar LOOSEN to find the Doctor holding a needle in his arm and Simon next to the Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Ted's feet.  His heels make lines in dirt as he is dragged from the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN Controllers at their monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on P.A.) This is Mercury control at "T" minus fifty minutes and counting.  Commence loading of passengers requiring special boarding assistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ground crew lift passengers who are stacked on a luggage tram and heave them onto a conveyor belt leading up to th ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE SALUCCI (imagine Van Heflin) bids his WIFE (imagine Cher) goodbye.  Joe is very nervous, sweating a lot.  His Wife hands him a few crumpled bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this, Joey.  It's my last few bucks. You'll need a hot meal when you get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've spent everything on these operations.  Is it really worth it?  We've pawned your mother's wedding ring.  The kids have no winter clothes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding a finger to his lips) Joey, what's more important, the kids' clothes or your sexual potency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiously looking around) I don't want to hear that word!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Joey.  The Doc says you gotta relax. This hospital in Des Moines is the best sex clinic in the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. (hands her an envelope) Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insurance.  Everyone buys it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Goodbye, Babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him.  He recoils, wipes off his mouth, and leaves.  She looks at the envelope, then yells at him through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey!  Remember, sexual impotence is nothing to be ashamed of!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire terminal looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted is tied to a chair surrounded by packing crates -- on is stamped "JIMMY HOFFA, THIS END UP" with the arrow pointing to the ground.  Ted struggles to free his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe Salucci stands at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cashier) Time, Newsweek, the Lifesavers, and the second time bomb from the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points at the shelf behind the Cashier where a number bombs are on display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The actual DR. BENJAMIN SPOCK stands in front of the machine.  Next to the machine at the magazine rack is a r bearded MAN in tweed jacket and a tartan kilt reading a magazine titled "GAY SCOTS."  Spock puts a coin in the machine and it explodes in sparks and smoke like the brid panel on "STAR TREK."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Scottish accent) My God, Dr. Spock!  You've got a meltdown in the Reggie Bars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe Salucci snaps his attache case closed.  Wipes the swe from his brow.  Takes out a "Des Moines" ticket and throw it away.  Looks at another ticket -- "Mercury."  Takes a last drag from his cigarette, throws it on the ground and hurries off.  The cigarette rolls under the "STORAGE ROOM door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, tied in chair, watches the cigarette roll up to some oil rags.  They burst into flame.  The flames lap up agai a yellow oil drum labeled "EXPLOSIVE."  PAN to three more drums labeled, "DYNAMIC!", "BRILLIANT!", "A MUST SEE!".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDITH and DAVE WALTERS, a middle-aged couple, carry their hand luggage.  Edith appears very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, Edith, space travel is safer than driving a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storage room door EXPLODES open in front of them.  Te flies out with the debris.  Edith faints.  Ted gets up, brushes himself off and heads to the ticket counter just the ticket agent flips a sign over that reads, "MERCURY - SOLD OUT."  Ted spots a SCALPER and reaches for his walle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercury seats.  I got a pair.  I got aisle seats, window seats.  Check 'em out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computerized panels line all walls.  Windows are similar an airplane -- outside carwash brushes soap down the nose The "HOT WAX" sign flashes.  Two attendants wipe windows with soap gloves and move to the DISTANT STRAINS of "CAR WASH."  Elaine sits at computer, two other CREW are in th seats.  Simon enters with Oveur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, this is Captain Oveur.  He's taking over for Frank Morgan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan was senselessly murdered about an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (black, sports afro) Murdered?  I hope it's not serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't know until after the autopsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  Welcome aboard, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to be aboard, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Oveur, your navigator, Mr. Unger, and your first officer, Mr. Dunn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oveur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oveur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think everyone knows Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Terrorists still seem confused as to where they're going.  They pass through the security metal detector, gu raised above their heads.  A GUARD runs a hand-held metal detector up and down their bodies.  At the same time, Mrs Gooch is being held spread-eagle against the wall.  One Guard holds a gun to her head, another frisks her.  Ted moves through behind the Terrorists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Guard) Is flight to Miami, yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young boy passes through the X-ray tunnel.  His dental chart appears on the screen.  A DENTIST at the other end stops him and looks in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BERGMAN FAMILY -- SVEN, KRISTA, and their two CHILDRE -- all dressed like the emigrants, look up at the "MERCUR GATE" sign.  They should be shot like characters from a Bergman "film."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercury, Krista.  A whole new world to be depressed about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya, Sven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will we die, Pappa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all die, Ingrid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will we die soon, Pappa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon?  What is the real meaning of 'soon'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car wash continues with attendants wiping the ship do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flips a switch) Atmosphere control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flips a switch) Atmosphere control, check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car wash attendant opens a side door to the cockpit and enters in headphones, moving to "CAR WASH," with a vacuum He cleans the floor and an ashtray and finds a baseball behind the Captain's seat which he pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flips a switch) Anti-gravity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car wash attendant floats to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flips a switch) Anti-gravity, check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attendant crashes to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine sits at the R.O.K.-4000 computer.  She seems to be having a problem with a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self) That's odd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A circuit board just below the R.O.K.-4000 logo shorts. Sparks fly.  A fire starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking out the window) I hope that weather doesn't give us a problem. (he opens the window and holds his hand out) What's your temperature reading, Mr. Unger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls a thermometer from his mouth) Ninety-eight point six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There seems to be some fog rolling in from the west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, give me a density reading.  I just hope it's not too heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading from a book like Richard Burton) The fog, the fog, the torment clouded my mind.  Derision, contempt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flight attendant, MARY MORRIS, welcomes passengers aboard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stella and father) Welcome aboard.  Isn't that Dr. Barrington, the world renowned agronomist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- he's dying and wants to be buried in the new l-a-n-d.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joe Salucci) Welcome aboard.  Can I take your case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clutching case) No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary gives him a look as he passes inside.  The OKIES mov by.  HENRY stops at door, bends down, picks up an ear of corn and pulls it apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a whole new world in front of us, Ma.  Where the dictatorship of the proletariat will lead workers and peasants into socialism without the revisionist diversions of bourgeois liberals, Trotskiests, or disillusioned Maoist terrorism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Okies pass inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at them; to self) Doesn't he realize that a weak proletariat needs a strong liberal bourgeoisie in a joint struggle against monopoly capitalism?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted stops at the door surrounded by boarding passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't begin to help you until you admit that you are sick, Ted. (echo) Sick Ted, sick Ted, sick Ted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boarding passengers look around for the echoing voice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarg looks up through the glass-walled corridor that lead to the ship door and spots Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to CO-WORKER) Well, I'll be a monkey's uncle; Ted Striker. (holding burnt wire) Jack, I got a bad feeling in my gut about this mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In b.g. a sign reads, "DANGER -- FUEL, ABSOLUTELY NO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you have for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fish, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarg bends down OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge EXPLOSION FILLS THE FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fog rolls past cockpit window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should be ready to launch as soon as this fog lifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ENGLISH BOBBY passes a woman in 19th-Century costume i the fog.  He tips his hat and moves on.  A caped man step out of the fog and strangles her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers are taking their seats.  Ted spots Elaine and moves towards her.  The Terrorists look confused.  Joe Salucci clutches his case and wipes his brow.  Mary takes a man's suit bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I hang that for you, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary hangs the bag from a rope noose in the closet, pulls lever, the bag drops like a man being executed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unger looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like that weather is clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dramatic stock footage of clouds parting and sun explodin through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted moves up to Elaine, who is about to enter the cockВ­p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted!  What are you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get in there.  I have to stop this flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, we're taking off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me by, Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please take your seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ted turns to Mary, Elaine slips into the cockpit and locks the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted tries the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine leans back against the door.  She is highly agitat Simon, the administrative officer, and other crew are in their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever your're ready, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, commander. (into radio) This is Mercury One.  Everything seems A- okay up here and ready for count-down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOOM to CLOSEUP of Elaine's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Rumack and Elaine walk across the well-groomed lawn. Elaine carries a box of spaghetti-to-go.  As they walk, t pass patients in wheelchairs pushed by nurses.  The furth they walk, the more wheelchairs appear until the lawn is jammed with two hundred wheelchairs bumping into each oth patients falling out, total wheelchair chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted seemed to get worse after I told him about Simon, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The human brain is a highly complex organ, Elaine, perhaps the most complex next to the bladder. (he stops at a patient in a wheelchair with his back TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you. (Rumack removes the top of the patient's skull and takes out his brain as they continue on) Ted's problem is in this area. (points with a pencil) This area, this area, here, here, here, under here, here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk OUT OF FRAME as wheelchair demolition derby FIL SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumack and Elaine walk INTO FRAME still talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you see, our task isn't made any easier by Ted's refusal to admit that he's sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do, Doctor Rumack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops next to a sign, "HOSPITAL GARDEN."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can eat balanced meals, exercise, and take Geritol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean for Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can be gentle with him, Elaine.  He's been working out a lot of his aggressions here in the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a good sign, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumack holds the "HOSPITAL GARDEN" sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is ripping up small trees, shrubs, etc., and throwing them onto a huge pile of mud that resembles the mountain that Dreyfuss built in "Close Encounters."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted ignores her as he works frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding out box) I brought you some spaghetti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted still ignores her as he works feverishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Ted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it, Elaine!  I've figured out what's wrong with the shuttle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted scurries around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, Elaine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ignores her.  Rumack walks up and puts an arm around h shoulder.  Elaine starts to sob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brain is an amazingly complex organ, Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he making any progress, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- last week that pile of mud was only this high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine takes her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark 'T' minus twenty and counting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, let's get this bucket into space. (flips switches) Ignition set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steam spews out from engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark 'T' minus thirty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN backs of a number of Controllers at screens, talking NASA jargon.  We PASS one in prison stripes talking throu mesh to his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flipping more switches) Ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'T' minus nine, eight, seven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rockets fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six, five, four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacobs runs in with a camera, yelling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!  One shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Controllers turn and smile.  The count-down stops. Jacobs flashes his camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Controllers continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two, one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship vibrates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have lift-off, Mercury One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The G-force causes the crew's hair to go straight back. Dunn's afro straightens and stays back throughout flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The G-force causes passengers' hair to go straight back. buxom woman looks down at her bust -- it's completely fla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The G-force returns to normal as the shuttle breaks earth gravitational hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jettison booster stages one and two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flipping switches) Booster jettisoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stock footage of booster falling away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cheap model of the Greenpeace 11 sails blithely along. booster stage careens through the atmosphere, crashes int the Greenpeace, and sinks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut down accelerators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accelerators down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew all look at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, ask ROK for a field interference scan.  Those sun spots might give us a problem with our communications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flipping computer switches) Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The computer is labeled R.O.K. She seems to have a proble getting it to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self) That's really strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The electrical fire continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine flips a switch on computer.  A "VOICE INTERFACE" s lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intermitant failure in scan mode "R". Analyze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self) That doesn't make sense. (to ROK) Repeat analysis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self) That's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut the Doubting Thomas shit, Elaine.  I know where I'm coming from on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparks fly, fire spreads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary moves down the aisle checking passengers.  She passe Father O'Flanagan who reads ALTERBOY magazine -- an alter in bikini bathing suit on cover.  She passes Mrs. Gooch w reads HIGH TIMES.  She stops at a ten-year-old GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess this is pretty exciting for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is.  How long will the trip take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our actual flight time is over fourteen months, but due to the time-space variant at sub-light speeds, our onboard flight time will be just over eighteen hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary leaves and the Girl turns to the WOMAN beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, Mom, how does that work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very tense) How many times do I have to tell you, I'm not your mother!  I've never seen you before!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman vibrates in multiple image and grabs her temple

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did she yell at me like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN who looks like Robert Young sits down beside the Gi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallucinating again, Rhonda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking a paper bag away from her face) I don't know what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's the brand of glue you've been sniffing.  Why don't you try this, NO-HI. It gives you all the pleasure of glue without the brain damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is completely bald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something to read, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clutching his case) Do you have PSYCHO MONTH?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.  Here you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a copy of PSYCHO MONTH with Alexander Haig' photo on cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted sits at a window seat and looks out.  A TEXAN sits on aisle.  Mary approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Texan) Would you like something to read?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't read a whole lot, but what have you got, hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME, NEWSWEEK, BUSINESS WEEK, and the TALMUD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to a car next to her with twenty-four large volumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twenty-four volume dissertation on the Hebrew law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me try that Talmud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ted) And you, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted) Oh... Popular Electronics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary hands him the POP ELEC.  He opens it.  The magazine sparks and smokes.  ZOOM to CLOSEUP of Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must admit that you're sick, Ted. (echo) Sick Ted, sick Ted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Psychiatrist looks around for the source of the echo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ted) Wanta switch when we're finished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted gets up and moves past the TEXAN, handing him the POP ELEC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  I need some oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon stands over Elaine's shoulder looking at ROK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got it straightened out now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down.  Elaine flips a switch on the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, I'm sorry about that little outburst a moment ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, ROK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I say something of a personal nature to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have great tits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up) Simon, I'm going to check ROK's secondary readout unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on intercom) Yes, Mary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary is on intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a little breakfast, Captain Oveur?  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple eggs and juice would be nice, Mary.  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on intercom) How would you like your eggs, Captain? Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Poached.  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on intercom) Poached and over, Captain Oveur?  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just poached on toast.  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on intercom) I don't think we do poached eggs on toast over, Captain Oveur.  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how I want them.  Poached.  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Captain Oveur.  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poached!  Not over!  Over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted breathes deeply on an oxygen unit.  He stops, but we still hear deep breathing.  LOOSEN to find Father O'Flana smoking a joint.  He smiles and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe Salucci clutches his attache case and wipes his brow. Mary leans over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should really put that case in the compartment above your head, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touching his shoulder) I can help you if you can't get it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary leaves, giving him a worried look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy holds his dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure an glad they let Scraps ride up here with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet Scraps is going to love Mercury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think things will be a lot different on Mercury, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be terrific.  A whole new world, new kids to play with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to love it, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more headlines about the rape trial and the fraud charges?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts to twitch) How many kids get a chance to live on another planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more kids yelling, 'Your old man's a thieving rapist'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Jimmy) Look, a man can make an honest mistake!! Anyway, she was asking for it!  They're all asking for it all the time!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not John's irregularity again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted throws water on his face, wipes it off with a towel while staring into himself in the mirror.  He sees the Psychiatrist in the mirror.  The Psychiatrist also washes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must admit that you're sick, Ted... sick, Ted... sick, Ted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Psychiatrist looks for the echo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOSE Psychiatrist.  Ted throws the paper towel into the toilet, and flushes.  The toilet sparks and smokes and ke running.  The running gets more intense as Ted tries to s it by hitting the handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted has to hold himself back as the suction builds in for He is just able to escape and shut the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted leans his back against the door and breathes heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We seem to have a malfunction in disposal unit four, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better check it, Unger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up) Done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted spots Elaine coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted.  I don't know why you got on this flight.  I don't know what you're trying to prove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, we have to go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't go back.  We had something very special, but it's all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, I mean the mission has to be aborted.  This ship should never have passed FSA inspection.  This thing is held together by string and chewing gum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cupboard door, labeled "EMERGENCY USE ONLY," swings ope behind Elaine revealing shelves of gum and string.  Elain shuts it without looking inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, get a grip on yourself.  You should never have left the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you do think I'm insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never used the word insane, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (facetiously) What word would you use, Elaine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word is sick.  Ted -- very, very, very sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you say if I told you the toilet just blew up in my face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd use the word insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
