dialogues.text: There's something dangerously wrong with this ship, Elaine.  I know its the wiring. That toilet's just the tip of the iceberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, a toilet's not going to kill anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unger jiggles the handle of the running toilet.  Suddenly sucks in towels, etc.  Unger is pulled down.  He fights back, grabbing onto towel rack that comes out of the wall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Texan with Talmud is now trying to wrap himself in tfilin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted walks down the aisle checking overhead panels.  He sp a panel that is half open.  A sign on the door reads, "DANGER -- VACUUM".  Ted opens it and a Hoover falls out his head, cutting him.  He holds a hanky to the wound and passes by Stella's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting over it.  If a relationship isn't working, you can't force it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean your head.  Sit down.  I'll take a look at it.  I'm a nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted sits down and Stella starts patching him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I opened this panel and a vacuum cleaner hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I mean your relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were in love but I'm not sure I know what love is anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love's the same as it always was.  It's people who change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People change in relation to each other. Love changes on its own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if the people change together in relation to that love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  But that's only when the love itself goes unchanged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the relationship remains the same and the love changes only when there's change in the two people who share that love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish it was that simple.  We really were in love.  You know how it is when you laugh all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella looks to her Father who is reading MORTUARY WORLD magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It's hard to L-A-U-G-H when your father's dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we laughed.  We laughed all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run towards each other.  Elaine grabs Ted by the wai picks him up and swings him around in SLOW MOTION.  They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We laughed when times were good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grave is surrounded by mourners in black with umbrell We PAN the weeping crowd until we get to Ted and Elaine. They are also dressed in black and drenched.  He holds he high by the waist, twirls her around as they laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even when times weren't so good, we still laughed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are locked in each other's arms in the middle of lovemaking and laughing heir heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But most of all, we laughed when we felt closest to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers are standing.  They hiss and throw vegeВ­table Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunn checks a red flashing light on his panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Oveur) Sir, I've got an overload in disposal unit four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better check on it, Mr. Dunn.  I'll stay here and fly the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunn gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oveur throws him a plunger and gives him a thumbs up.  Th exchange that "man must do what a man must do" smile.  Ma enters with Jimmy Wilson -- carrying Scraps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if Jimmy here takes a look around, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.  Come on in, Jimmy. (checking his navigational screen) That's strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon leans over Oveur's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraps looks at Oveur.  Jimmy looks at the array of dials etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an asteroid field.  There shouldn't be anything like that in this sector unless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraps looks at Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraps looks at Oveur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless those sunspots are interfering with our scanner or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraps looks at Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraps looks at Oveur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or we're off course, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraps looks at Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraps looks at Oveur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we couldn't be off course.  Our coordinates are computer-locked barring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraps looks at Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraps looks at Oveur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barring a computer failure.  There was talk of sub-par wiring in this ship.  I hope that's just talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraps' ears prick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon moves past Jimmy, stops at the door and downs a handful of anti-fear pills before leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on up, Jimmy.  Say, that's some puppy.  What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scraps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I hold him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing over Scraps) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding him up and looking at his underbelly) He's a boy dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like it when Scraps sleeps on his back, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Stella.  Stella is feeding her father and listeni to Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kept me in the asylum for eight months.  I know everyone in those places claims they're sane, but I was different, I was sane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted notices Unger float by outside his window.  ZOOM to CLOSEUP of Ted.  He tries to take a drink and pours it on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine is fighting the fire with an extinguisher.  She ge it out and looks at the burnt wires in the area labeled, "ROK, MORAL CENTRE."  ZOOM to CLOSEUP of Elaine.  She tur TO CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, I want you to relax.  Let your mind go back, back past your youth, past your childhood to your mother's womb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted becomes slightly hypnotized.  ZOOM to CLOSEUP of Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fetus that looks like Ted is curled up inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to remember your birth.  Was it difficult?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker, listen to me!  This is Doctor Krane!  You're twisted around, Striker. You've got to come out feet first!  You're too low in the womb!  You're too low, Striker!  You're... (fading) ... too low...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella shakes Ted's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, are you okay?  Here, take one of these stress pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella hands him a pill which he pops automatically, but misses his face with his drink.  She leaves the bottle ne to Ted.  ZOOM on bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella starts feeding her father again.  The ship jolts a his face goes into the tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine fiddles with the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROK) Request; comprehensive electrical systems check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Systems check positive.  Look, Elaine, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Request; life support systems check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life support check.  Elaine, it's obvious you've been ignoring me.  You're a woman. I can relate to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicky and confused) Request; self-analysis of ROK hardware and software systems regarding behavioral changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing wrong with me, Elaine. What about tonight -- just you and me.  We can be alone.  I can get rid of everyone else on the ship -- I've already proven that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine gasps and moves away from ROK's blinking eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon takes a long slug from a flask.  LOOSEN to FIND Jim and Scraps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to talk about it, Commander?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunn is about to enter with the plunger as Mary passes. ship jolts and she falls into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you feel that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his pants) Yes I did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felt like a large asteroid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it did.  Mr. Dunn, can I ask you a personal question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Mary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...  Do you people scream right when you... you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunn gives her a look and opens the washroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunn is immediately pulled down to the raging toilet bowl He grabs for the door screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary hears the scream and gives a look as she leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testa is serving the Walters coffee from a steaming pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand me your cup.  This is very hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  And, stewardess, can you please tell my wife that there is nothing that can go wrong.  I think she'd like to hear it from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testa spots Dunn's tattered sleeve emerge from the washro door, groping for a handhold.  She screams and dumps coff in Edith's face.  She runs to help Dunn, grabs his sleeve It comes off in her hands.  She keeps pulling.  His jacke comes off, his pants, underwear, socks, an entire clothesline of garments like bras, towels, etc.  She hear SCREAM.  Then silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine and Oveur.  Elaine stands over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we have any alternative, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.  What do you think our alternatives are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to disconnect ROK's higher brain functions without disturbing his regulatory system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do it from up here, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather sit down for this one, Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean you can do it from the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.  You better get back there and monitor the regulatory unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine leaves and Mary enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, the coffee machine is jammed and I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you tried it with a little cinnamon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary gives a "why didn't I think of that" look.  Testa enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Oveur, Dunn and Unger have been sucked out through disposal unit four!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both together?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunn and Unger have been sucked out through disposal unit four!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, calm down.  Here's how we're going to play it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary and Testa look over his shoulder.  He has a basketba play diagram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary, I want you here.  Testa, you move across here past Dawkins' pick and get the ball at the top of the key from Irving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all clasp hands and "yell."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It careens through asteroids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oveur is pulling curcuit board from ROK panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oveur eyes ROK but keeps working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oveur continues.  Smoke spews out.  He hears a HISS and looks at a vent.  He grabs his throat and collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An asteroid bounces off hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers scream.  Blonde woman in Viking helmet with sp stands and screams operatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon enters and spots Oveur slumped in his seat.  He pul him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) Pills... (points to his mouth) Pocket... (points to his pocket) Vent... (points to vent) Gas... Yankees... four... (points to RADIO that plays

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sox... zip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon rips open his coat, grabs pills and takes them hims letting Oveur drop.  Simon looks down at the navigational screen -- it resembles an old amusement parlor roadrace game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self) We're off course, heading right through that asteroid field and right at the... at the sun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship takes another violent shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passengers are screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands in the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me!  Listen to me, my children!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please listen.  Thank you, my children. I'm a man of God, you must trust me when I say... we're all going to die!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passengers go totally insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A number of Controllers group around a console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  They're off course and heading right for the sun.  I've seen enough, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Controller 2 hits a switch and the console screen flips t baseball game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me Jack McCrosky and fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCrosky?  He hasn't handled a tower in twenty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since Reagan fired the controllers, he's been completely senile and hasn't done a day's work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about McCrosky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much the same as Reagan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Nurses stand by a phone in a dormitory of beds.  Many old men sleep or eat in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for Mr. McCrosky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think we should bother him?  He's been acting a bit odd lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look to McCrosky (Lloyd Bridges).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON McCROSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is in bed in scuba gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine.  He just thinks he's Lloyd Bridges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse 1 takes the phone to McCrosky.  He is a lot older t in "Airplane."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone's for you, Mr. McCrosky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY What's a phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding it to his ear) Here, let me help you.  I think it's the space centre.  Now, let's not get too excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY What? (pause) What? (pulls off his scuba mask and snorkle) What? (gets more alert and grabs a cigarette) I'll be right down! (he hangs up and jumps out of bed) Looks like I picked the wrong time to go senile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon is taking another slug of booze; Elaine enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon! (she spots Oveur slumped on the panel) Captain Oveur!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine pulls him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still gasping) Mets... nine... Phils... three... Cubs... four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine drops him and turns to Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon, what's happening?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to disconnect ROK.  It gassed him.  That computer is running this ship and we're heading right for the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we change course?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're computer locked and the manual navigation unit is down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine looks at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Ted was right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: for her realization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My career is shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your career!  What about the lives of those people out there.  Simon, what happened to the man I thought I loved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to get Ted.  Just don't come apart on me now, Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves.  Simon's uniform starts bursting at the seams buttons pop off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Terrorists stop Elaine.  There's pandemonium in the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is flight to Miami, yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine addresses the PASSENGERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to passengers) Please, ladies and gentlemen, please calm down.  Listen to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been thrown off course just a tad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In space terms, about 70 million miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Passengers appear interested and sensible, nod their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bumps you feel are car-sized asteroids smashing into the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hood of a car smashes through the cabin wall.  The Passengers still appear interested and sensible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, we're heading right for the sun and can't seem to change course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers still appear interested and sensible.  They al put on sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you telling us everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly.  We're also out of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Passengers errupt in total panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sparks, smokes, overheats and EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passengers go insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pray with me, my children.  Pray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Father, I'm not Catholic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then worship the god of your choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Gooch pulls out a fertility idol with a huge, erect penis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always loved you, darling.  I was unfaithful just once.  Remember Jill, my first secretary?  Forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew all about it.  I was unfaithful once, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all behind us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember Harriet, your first receptionist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to crash!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God is great!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death to America!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The yellow pencil is on the table of my aunt!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is absolutely nothing to worry about!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your crew is in complete control of the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCrosky bursts through the doors and heads to the monito He wears a raincoat and shirt and tie.  He is met by Controller 1.  They move across room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Get me a cup of coffee, mister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY And a gallon of milk of magnesia, and a ham on rye, no cheese!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir! Welcome home, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCrosky takes off his raincoat revealing scuba tank.  He takes off his tank as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching McCrosky) Here are the navigational charts, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Controller passes.  McCrosky stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Get me a readout on their fuel capacity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's all the available information on the sun.  That thing's hot, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCrosky takes the info and burns his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Ahhhhhh!  Get me Bud Kruger immediately! (spotting Jacobs) Jacobs, I want to know absolutely everything that's happened up till now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First the earth cooled.  Then the dinosaurs came but were too big and died and everything got rotten and turned into oil and the Arabs bought Mercedes Benzs and then there was the best TV special on Judy Garland.  Then we lost the war with Albania.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCrosky leaves Jacobs babbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Things sure haven't changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCrosky stands in front of a huge painting of himself. Both he and painting are in the same pose -- one hand loosens the tie, he drinks coffee with the other, a cigarette dangles from his lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is lost in thought.  SUPER IMAGES:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Ted getting electro-shock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Psychiatrist telling him he's sick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Ted building the "Close Encounters" mound

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted is shaken out of his dream by Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, Ted.  Listen to me, Ted.  You were right all along.  Ted, we've lost the crew and Simon's turned to jelly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon is a jelly mold inside a uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Come in, Mayflower.  This is mission control.  Over.  Come in, Mayflower! Over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy pokes his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to talk about it now, Commander?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine stands over Ted looking at the empty bottle of str pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella approaches in nurse's uniform splattered with bloo A cigarette dangles from her lip.  She wipes her hands on blood-splattered towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's finally come to terms with his own psychosis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he was right!  He's not crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss, I'm a nurse with a dying F-A-T-H-E- R, I know what I'm talking about.  Now I'm going to need fresh sheets, gauze, Q-tips, and all the vaseline you have on board! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine leaves, looking back at Ted with empathy.  Mary passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mary) I'll need all the boiling water you can get your hands on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary leaves and a MAN passes holding a tattered arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a nurse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (handing him a urine bottle) The washroom's down there on your right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man leaves, a quizzical look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling after him) And not too much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK U.S. ARMY SERGEANT (imagine Jim Brown) approaches Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella hands him an M-16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep an eye on that side of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant drops into a seat next to a window, smashes the glass with his rifle butt and is immediately sucked o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY moves down the aisle with a cart collecting boiling water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to passengers) I'll need all your boiling water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers pull pots of boiling water from under their seats, handbags, coat pockets, and pour them into the passing container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testa reassures Bob and Alice Wilson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should be out of this momentarily. There's nothing to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  That makes me feel so much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testa leaves and Father O'Flanagan approaches with last rites paraphernalia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, I'm a priest.  We're in shit up to our ears.  Who wants last rites?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is now completely entangled in the tfilin and struggle to free himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine passes Ted carrying sheets, vaseline, etc.  She lo at him sitting there in a fog, gives up and leaves.  Ted looks at the red flashing "FASTEN YOUR SEATBELTS" sign. takes him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the hospital deep in b.g. across an expansive lawn Suddenly Ted's face pops INTO FRAME, CLOSEUP.  He looks b ways and bolts.  He wears a straightjacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the dogs scramble INTO FRAME in front of the sig slobbering.  A half-dozen viscious-looking GUARDS in reflector shades with shotguns, whips, nets, cattle prods follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Southern accent) Damn!  I want that patient shot on sight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted stands at window.  A neon "BAR" sign flashes outside close to the window that the only way to read it is to re this room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you gotta be crazy to end up behind the eight ball like this.  Anyway, you find out pretty fast who your friends are when you're on the lamb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted turns away from the window and passes the lamb in bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to lamb) I'm going out for cigarettes and a fifth of bourbon.  Don't wait up for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted grabs his straightjacket and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virgin wool.  Nothin' but headaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Bo Peep staff is flung against door as it closes behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: an empty, spotless, wet street.  One car parked under a street lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I travelled at night in the shadows.  I didn't want to attract attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid to step out of the doorways. You never know what to expect when you're on the run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted steps into light.  GLORIA STEINAM passes with CAB CALAWAY.  A grand PIANO SMASHES to pavement next to Ted. ignores piano and gives Gloria and Cab a quizzical look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps in a puddle where a "BAR-COCKTAILS" sign is reflected.  The reflection shatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A streetcleaning truck approaches spewing out garbage rat than water.  Ted's ankles are sprayed with garbage.  He bends down and picks up a wet matchbook -- "HARRY'S PLACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing, looking at a bar.  The glow of flashing neon si reflects off his face.  He pulls out a cigarette.  A woma hand shoots INTO FRAME holding a lit zippo.  Ted draws deeply on the cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There I was, minding my own business when I looked up and saw a pair of legs that went forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN UP AND UP AND UP.  She is all legs -- no torso, no he just legs -- about two stories high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I had a date with Harry's.  It was little more than a hole in a wall on the south side of Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bashed in the side of a brick wall.  A neon sign over the hole reads, "HARRY'S GOODTIME BAR."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dark, smokey bar.  PAN very tough faces standing along th bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's was perfect for me.  The kind of place you go if you don't want to be recognized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEEP PANNING tough faces, but now they all wear Groucho glasses and noses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was rough, real rough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with four players -- all have broken thumbs in casts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kind of place you could score anything, from junk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One guy hands another guy a large, rusted car fender for money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to Phil Donahue's book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHIL DONAHUE signs a stack of books at a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At Harry's you could count on a fight breaking out almost every night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO PROFESSORS argue at a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I say essence precedes existence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy!  Existence precedes essence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Essence!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Existence!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor 2 slugs Professor 1 sending him flying across t room.  Professor 1 gets up and throws a judo chop which Professor 2 stops by holding a book up in both hands.  Th book splits in two like a piece of wood split by a karate chop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a small trio in one corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two midgets play light jazz -- piano and bass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a larger trio in the other corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five 300-pound musicians play some tune in another corner

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out a cigarette.  A bare foot with zippo held in toes comes INTO FRAME and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last thing I wanted was Elaine to see me down on my luck.  Well, it was just my luck.  In she walked with a group from the space program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine and Simon and two other couples, who look like cle cut NASA types out of "The Right Stuff," walk in laughing and take a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd come to Harry's to slum it and try their hand at the video bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group prod Elaine to try the bull.  A cowboy hat flie across the room.  She grabs it, pulls it on, and moves to the bull which is surrounded by others in cowboy hats. Elaine hops in the saddle.  A sinister character puts a quarter in and madly flips knobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The saddle doesn't move -- all the action is on the scree but Elaine throws one hand back and kicks her legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine made that ride look easy.  It was obvious why I was still nuts about her. She loved life.  I didn't want her to notice me so I borrowed a pair of dark glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted takes a pair of dark glasses off a passing blind man walks perfectly until the glasses are gone, then starts stumbling and crashes over a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabbed an alto sax and joined the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted takes an alto sax from a passerby who also stumbles a crashes over a table when he loses his sax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stayed in the background not wanting to draw attention to myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks around trying to see where the terrible grating sax sound is coming from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what happened?  Elaine's crowd talks her into joining us for a song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine hops up on the stage, grabs a mike and starts to s "Stormy Weather."  She sidles up to Ted and goes into a medley of old songs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine's singing is just as bad as Ted's sax.  They have cleared the joint and play and sing alone.  Elaine's grou finally pull her out.  She hasn't recognized Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ted) I don't know who you are or how you lost your sight, but I'll never forget this night as long as I live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK leaving Ted alone on the stage still playing. Chairs are turned up on tables.  One table has chairs tur up with the people still sitting in the chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: getting a glass of water outside cockpit door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon emerges.  As the door opens we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, Mayflower.  Over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon shuts the door and bumps into Ted who is getting a drink of water.  Simon takes a drink of booze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurtz, you're drunk.  Who's in command of this ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That damn computer has taken over.  I'm getting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Elaine was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk to me about Elaine.  Outta my way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Simon) Pull yourself together!  We've got to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon slugs Ted who falls into a corner and hits his head ZOOM TO CLOSEUP of Ted unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship takes another violent jolt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It roars through the asteroid field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon sits on toilet seat and slides open a wall panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father O'Flanagan slides open an adjacent wall panel and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, what should I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you considered suicide, my son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A panel on the other side of Simon slides open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to talk about it now, Commander?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (holding radio mike) Come in, Mayflower.  Over.  Do you read me?  Over.  Damnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCrosky throws the mike down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking mike) Let me try, sir.  Come in, Mayflower. Over.  Come in.  Over.  Damnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Controller 1 throws the mike even harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking mike) Let me try, sir.  Come in.  Over.  Damnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Controller 2 smashes the mike through the monitor screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me try, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Controller 3 smashes the monitor with an axe.  Controller smashes the monitor with an electric guitar.  Other Controllers line up for their turns with various heavy implements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON McCROSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (to Controller 5) Stinson, have you contacted the families of the passengers and crew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCrosky looks out window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Try and calm them down.  And for God sake, be diplomatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stinson turns to two burly men in leather jerkins and bla hoods.  They hold a large caldron of molten lead next to window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give 'em the lead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pour it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It careens through the asteroid field towards the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted lies unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's doing her rounds -- takes a medical chart from the back of a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a male passenger) I'm afraid that leg's going to have to come off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A leg is passed to her from OUT OF FRAME.  She takes it w still looking at the chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.  This isn't your chart.  You just had a touch of air sickness. (handing him back his leg) You'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN sitting next to the MAN WHO IS HOLDING HIS LEG gr Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her hand) And I'm a nurse.  Everything will be okay. Pass it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man with the leg passes it to the passenger in seat behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything will be okay.  Pass it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The leg gets passed from seat to seat as passengers say, "Everything will be okay.  Pass it on."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lying unconscious in a corner.  A puppy crawls INTO FRAME and starts licking his face.  LOOSEN TO FIND Jimmy standi over Ted.  Ted comes to, feels his jaw and pulls himself The ship jolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you feeling okay, mister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm feeling just fine, son.  Just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted pushes by Jimmy, a look of great purpose on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine enters looking for Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cockpit is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you read, Mayflower?  Over.  This is mission control.  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine gasps.  She leaps into the Captain's seat and grab radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.  This is the Mayflower.  Over! Come in, anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Controllers are gathered around one monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (on radio) We read you, Mayflower!  Identify yourself and give your position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Elaine Thompson.  I'm five-six, 123 pounds with brown hair and I'm sitting down and facing the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Elaine Thompson!!  What in sam hill is a woman doing in charge of that ship?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's got her shit together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, there's no time to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted picks up Oveur who is still gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packers... seven... Vikings... three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted drags him onto the floor and takes his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (V.O.) Come in, Mayflower!  Over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, I was wrong about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach out and hold hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (V.O.) Come in!  Over!  Come in!  Over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all make mistakes, Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (V.O.) Come in Mayflower!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I ever have doubted you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (V.O.) This is mission control!  Over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all behind us now, Elaine.  And no matter what happens, I want you to know I've always loved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (V.O.) Jesus, would someone answer me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (V.O.) What the hell's going on up there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Elaine still smile at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All passengers look forward and smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Controller's look down the line and smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six soldiers on firing squad duty, ready to fire, turn, smile, and FIRE while they're smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted grabs the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling lovingly) Ted, this reminds me of twenty years ago over Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted hits a switch.  The ship does a barrel roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we see are feet sticking up from the seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) This is Mayflower One calling mission control.  Do you read me?  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY A man.  Now that's more like it. (continuing on radio) This is mission control.  Identify yourself and give me your position.  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) The name's Ted Striker and I'm sitting down and facing the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (trying to place the name) Striker... Striker... Striker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slugs the female worker next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (remembering) Ted Striker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Damn!  We've lost them again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be those sunspots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be your dishwashing detergent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Striker's the guy who flew that 736 into Chicago over 20 years ago without a crew. Would someone tell me what in sam hill he's doing up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving his hand in the air) Me!  Me!  Me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are swinging aluminum doors similar to restaurant kitchens and hospital operating rooms.  Kruger and the Commissioner enter through one door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys downtown are taking the heat from the boys in Washington and the boys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They PASS OUT OF FRAME.  A waiter with tray passes them a leaves through the swing doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two surgeons in operating gowns and masks enter covered i food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PICK UP Kruger and the Commissioner still walking and talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, the President wants an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach McCrosky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Sorry to pull you out of bed at this hour, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.  I was reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was reading too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some southern plantation owner falls in love with this poor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was asking McCrosky, Commissioner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY He falls in love with this poor school teacher who...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CONTROLLER interrupts them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to McCrosky) Sir, we've restored radio transmission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Good. (to Kruger) We keep losing their radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me straight, McCrosky -- what's it look like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY It's green with numbers and lots of knobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the radio, the situation.  I want to know exactly what your people think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN three Controllers at monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) They're screwed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) They're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) Did I leave the iron on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship lurches from side to side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella, covered in blood, kneels beside BILLY, a young ma bandaged head to toe, lying on a stretcher with lots of I bottles hanging around him.  A U.S. ARMY GENERAL stands n to him -- imagine General Patton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Walker is here, Billy.  He wants to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, if we get through this thing alive, I'd like you to get this letter to my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Billy a letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine is monitoring various dials.  Ted is at controls a on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) An electrical fire in the core has played havoc with the ROK-4000 computer.  It's locked us on a direct line with the sun and there's no way we can go to manual. Captain Oveur already tried it and he's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from floor) Giants sixty... Rams... zip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... become an intolerable bore.  The rest of the crew has been lost В­and we're out of coffee.  Also, we're starting to feel the sun's heat pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker wipes his forehead.  Elaine holds a tan reflector to her face and turns to the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers sweat profusely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN slaps a mosquito on the back of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR MEN sit nude to the waist, wrapped in towels as if i steam bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's eight-thousand square feet with great parking and a twenty-year lease with option to buy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't lose, Al.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can lose.  I've seen it happen a thousand times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It shoots towards sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCrosky sits at a monitor, talks into a mike and looks d at a book.  Behind him two Controllers make a dope deal - baggie of grass for cash.  We only see their midsections hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Striker, this is Jack McCrosky, chief controller.  I want you to listen to me and listen good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buyer checks out the baggie -- it's mostly twigs.  Th seller is trying to explain the situation with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Twenty years ago I helped a young pilot through a storm over Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buyer grabs the seller's shirt and tries to get cash back.  A fight ensues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY He didn't have a crew either.  He said he couldn't do it.  But when the going got tough that kid pulled it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seller's shirt is ripped.  Knives are pulled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY You might have read about him; he made all the big papers and the Canadian Jewish News.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seller is stabbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY I don't know where he is today but if he was up there right now, I know he'd find some way to turn that bucket around and get the hell out of there, pronto!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could talk like that -- so macho yet so sensitive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON McCROSKY'S BOOK - "PEP TALKS FOR ALL OCCASIONS"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCrosky slams it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY I just hope I said the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you gave the wrong speech. McCrosky.  I'm not your problem.  It's this ship.  That computer's gone bananas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (holding up the book) Why the hell are we still using the old manual!  Burn this book!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smiling blonde man in a white sweater with "MORAL MAJORITY" on the front walks by and takes the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (on radio) Just hold on, Striker, we'll get back to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted writes a note to Elaine and hands it to her -- it rea "WE MUST FIND SOME WAY TO BLOW THAT COMPUTER!"  Elaine lo a bit nervous and licks her lip.  They look up at ROK's pulsating eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testa pokes her head in.  She's soaked with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabin temperature is rising.  The passengers want to know what's happening up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us handle this end of things.  Now what's the coffee situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just won't drip!  I've tried everything.  And the passengers are dropping like flies from the heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers reel and drop to floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, I'm going back there.  Just hold onto that stick and try to control this hunk of tin as best you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, please be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted leaves.  We hear an enormous CRASH on the other side the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE DIMAGGIO (MR. COFFEE), drinking a cup of coffee, rush in accompanied by a GROUND CONTROL OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joe) It doesn't look good.  The drip seems to be jammed up pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they change the filter and wait for the brew sign to light up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping and looking Mr. Coffee in the eye) To tell you the truth, sir, I don't really know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One holds a hat, one pulls a slip of paper from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading his slip) Eighty-three.  What's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If eighty-three passengers die, you win the two hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach McCrosky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. McCrosky, Mr. Coffee.  Coffee, McCrosky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Thanks for coming down so soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking watch) I won't come down for another couple hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY I'll put you on the radio with Striker. Jeez you look familiar.  Did you ever play water polo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to my knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY I thought so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It roars towards the sun.  The nose of the ship begins to glow red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "MERCURY SHUTTLE HEADS FOR DISASTER"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set logo reads, "NEWS 4 BUFFALO."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four alarm fire rages through downtown Buffalo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercury shuttle heads for sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set logo reads, "NEWS 4 TOKYO"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitles) Four alarm fire guts Tokyo apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitles) Mercury mission in death struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set logo reads, "NEWS 3 MOSCOW."  A gun is held to ANCHORMAN'S head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitles) Four alarm fire in downtown Moscow clears way for glorious new tractor factory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitles) Capitalist, imperialist adventurism ends in space disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this country was run by vegetarian women who's old men deserted them after knocking them up instead of by meat-eating males, this thing never would have happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A banner hangs over terminal door:  "HOUSTON WELCOMES SPA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP OF ATTACHE CASE being carried to the door -- stic on it reads, "NATIONAL ENQUIRER."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP OF ANOTHER CASE coming from other direction -- sticker on it reads, "NATIONAL STAR."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cases meet.  LOOSEN to REPORTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to STAR) I never forget a face.  'Texas doctor claims sex with chicken cures baldness?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Severed legs grow back after Utah man finds Christ?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long time no see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands and turn into the terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Controllers stand over Mr. Coffee -- everyone sips coffee and smokes cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Have you got the back panel off the brew manifold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted has the coffee machine apart, wears a headset and hol wires in pliars.  Anxious passengers with coffee cups sta over him -- they are all totally wired and going cold turkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into headset) Check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a terminal at the base of the coil.  That's your contact point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PASSENGER bends down and picks a coffee bean off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a coffee bean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (maniacally) He's got a bean!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A riot ensues.  The "bean" Passenger is beaten to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into headset) It looks like the solder point has melted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enraged) Just what I thought.  When the hell will you people realize that adding extra water after the initial brew cycle overheats the system!!  Now listen to me, Striker, and listen good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It careens towards the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Hallick storms in and up to McCrosky.  He flash his badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's in charge here, Mister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY McCrosky, Control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallick, homicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacobs, Pisces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kruger, Sagittarius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commissioner, Aquarius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have information that one of your passengers is carrying a bomb and might be suicidal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Where'd you get this information, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have our methods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what methods are those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you heard of the Heimlich method?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY The method of saving someone choking on a piece of gristle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRUGER/McCROSKY/COMMISSIONER We're familiar with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  This is the passenger's wife.  Mrs. Joe Salucci.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She approaches very distressed looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY What makes you think your husband might want to blow up that shuttle, ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes into her purse for the insurance form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This insurance policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large ivory colored vibrator drops out of her purse, hi the floor, and flips on.  They all look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An electric tooth. (handing McCrosky the insurance form) Joey was supposed to go to Des Moines for an operation to cure his impotence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY The Des Moines Institute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRUGER/McCROSKY/COMMISSIONER Yes, we're familiar with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I found out Joey got on this shuttle instead and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way I read it, blowin' up a plane in space leaves no traces, if you know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not exactly sure what you mean, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No blood.  No body.  No bones.  No eyes. No ears.  No throats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (looking at form) This is $500,000 worth of insurance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kruger, Commissioner, and Hallick all whistle "wow!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Just a second.  This is insurance on his car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what worries me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's impotent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's suicidal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's stupid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) This is it, Striker.  You got one shot and one shot only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker stands over the coffee machine, sweating like mad The Passengers with cups hang over him. He makes contact with a wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self) Contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MACHINE EXPLODES.  Coffee gushes out like an oil well coming in.  The Passengers dance under the gusher of brow liquid, mouths open and cheering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY How are we going to handle this bomb nut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rushes up with printouts) Here are the tests we ran on their computer.  I had them В­xeroxed for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY How'd they come out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upside-down, but I turned each page over and put them in order.  I'm afraid that computer is totally capable of taking control of that ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Let's keep cool.  There's gotta be a way to control it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rushes up with diagrams) These are their position calculations. They've got about ten minutes before they start to burn up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Keep calm.  A lot can happen in ten minutes. (to self) What next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sips his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rushes in) Sir, your headlights are on and your doors are locked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (spitting out coffee, Danny Thomas style) Jesus!!  I'll be right back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCrosky races out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It heads closer to the sun.  The nose is glowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine is checking computer.  The cockpit is steaming now She unbuttons her uniform just as Ted comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, we've only got ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking she wants sex) Not now, Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean until we start to burn up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted takes his seat and looks at a panel gauge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're closer to the sun than I estimated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One is labeled "EXACT DISTANCE" and reads, "76.50".  The other is labeled "ESTIMATED DISTANCE" and reads, "5689465932.09".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, Mayflower.  This is Bud Kruger. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) This is Striker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Look, Striker, I don't know how you got into that driver's seat but I want Simon Kurtz on that radio and I want him now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Kurtz was the one who got us into this mess in the first place.  You people knew this ship wasn't ready to fly.  You played God with over a hundred lives, Kruger, and for what -- the prestige of your precious space program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was very well put, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacobs stands next to Kruger rubbing his forefingers together in the "shame, shame" sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Striker, you're heading right for the sun, so don't you think it's a little late for that bleeding heart liberal crap now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a point, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are columns under Kruger's and Striker's names. Striker has two check marks.  Jacobs gives Kruger one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Call me a bleeding heart, but if we get through this thing I'm preparing a paper on alternative spending directives recommending the transfer of space program funds to low cost housing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Just put Kurtz on that radio!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCrosky rushes in and grabs the mike from Kruger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (enraged) Look, Kruger, you and your people have caused enough trouble already.  I don't care about your political games, I care about only one thing, the lives of those people up there!!!  Out of my control room!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's car wouldn't start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (on mike) Striker, this is McCrosky.  Give me five minutes and keep your fingers crossed. (to Stinson) Stinson, get me the Mayflower plans! (to Controller 3) You, clear this table!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the cards and bridge mix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY And someone get me the Sarg!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leaning over the ship's plans.  He is eating another ciga All Controllers stand around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my little girl, my little darlin', my sweetheart, my honey, and you want to blow her belly out with that bomb.  If you blast here in the computer core and the fuselage doesn't give way here and the main communication lines to the cockpit hold here and this baby here doesn't jam this little old unit up here and throw about two tons of hot steel through here like a hot knife through butter and the upper and lower...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY What's your point, Sarg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Then it's settled.  The bomb is Striker's only chance.  Are there any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Those are answers, I asked for questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should a man in his forties have a circumcision?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Elaine, this might be it if those guys on the ground don't think of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you to know, I love you Ted and always will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That might be the news we've been waiting for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (V.O.) I've got some news for you, Striker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Elaine smile hopefully at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (V.O.) One of your passengers is carrying a bomb and is suicidal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A b...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She covers her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (V.O.) No, a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe Salucci wipes his brow, lays his case on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Mary huddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which passenger is Joe Salucci?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixteen 'C', why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's carrying a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A b...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She covers her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, a bomb.  Now, as discreetly as possible, I want you to move the passengers into the lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.  Just don't let Salucci think we're onto him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted moves down the aisle.  Mary gets on the P.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would everyone not carrying a bomb please move to the lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Passengers go nuts screaming, "A bomb!!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping up with his case) Don't anyone move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the passengers pile up in a ceiling-to-floor wall beh Ted -- he extends his arms, holding them back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Salucci, listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted takes a step forward away from the wall of passengers the wall crumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, you don't want to blow that thing and kill all these innocent people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to live anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, the insurance policy won't help your wife and kids.  You bought auto insurance, not life insurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inching up on him) That's right, Joe.  Now, no one's going to hurt you and no one has to know what's wrong with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted is almost up to Joe when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells) That's the guy from the terminal who can't get it up!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe bolts.  Passengers panic.  Ted tackles him.  The case flies into the air in SLOW MOTION.  It turns slowly, hang for the longest time as we CUT, still in SLOW MOTION, to horrified faces watching it.  This SLOW MOTION sequence lasts for about 60 seconds -- people put on make-up, do macrame, read, etc. -- while the case is still in the air Suddenly, Scraps leaps high into the air in SLOW MOTION a comes down with the case between his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Controllers huddle over one monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Get that bomb, Striker!  Get that bomb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, Control!  We have the bomb!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got the bomb!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just like an election in Iran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted is back at the controls -- the cockpit is incredibly now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This heat's getting unbearable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down and sees two eggs frying on the dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is a dry heat, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Controllers are grouped around the plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Do we use the bomb to blow that computer or is there another way?  I want to know what everyone thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think... (changes mind) ... No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could knock out the wall between the cockpit and cabin, and hang plants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think... (changes mind) ... No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't knock that wall out.  That's a support wall, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think... (changes mind) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I flush?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Then it's settled.  We use the bomb. (grabs radio) Striker, McCrosky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (V.O.) We've gone over the blueprints and you've got only one option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) I know what you're going to say, McCrosky -- knock out the wall between the cockpit and cabin and hang plants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (V.O.) Forget it.  That's a support wall.  Use the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The b...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She covers her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (V.O.) I keep telling you, not the b...  The bomb!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to self) Why, you'd have to be crazy to try a stunt like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine looks at Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All passengers look forward in Ted's direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER the womb over Ted's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too low in the womb, Striker! You've got to come out feet first!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs case) Elaine.  I'm going back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted... I love you.  Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (to his controllers) I want everyone on their toes for this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handing out ballet slippers to the Controllers who are passing a joint down the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY And if anyone has any ideas, I want to hear them now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a show just like Hollywood Squares but with kids.  Gary Coleman could host.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Passengers stand in the aisle listening to Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I want everyone to move to the front of the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers move calmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine.  Stay calm.  We just want everyone as far away from the blast as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Passengers panic and stampede right over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted wears a gas mask and attaches the time-bomb to the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Ted?  Why are you wearing that mask, Ted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas spews out of a vent.  Ted makes sure his gas mask is tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon is dressed in space suit and moving down the aisle. Elaine holds onto him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon!  Wait!  What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass Father O'Flanagan.  He has a Bongo drum at his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the 'B', sixteen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've lost the ship and now I've lost you, Elaine.  I'm getting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon, I didn't want it to end like this. We can be friends!  You'll die out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon, what are you saying?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon steps into a hatch labeld, "ESCAPE CAPSULE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying, I can't take the singles scene again, Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hatch door slams shut.  A passenger passes with a sandwich board that reads, "JESUS WAS A SINGLE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy appears and yells through the window on the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to talk about it now, Commander?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The capsule ejects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commissioner stands in front of the painting of astronauts on black velvet.  He is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the President of the United States.  Tell him it's the Commissioner. (to Kruger) I don't know how the old man's going to take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRESIDENT poses for a photo session:  CLOSEUP of President holding aloft in a victory salute, the hands of two black men.  On the camera flash we LOOSEN to reveal t bodiless arms of two black mannequins.  An AID hands the phone to the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Houston, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking phone) This is the President... What?!... What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks past a wall of photos of past presidents:  JFK, Johnson, Nixon, Ford, Carter, Reagan, Reagan older, Reaga much older, Merv Griffin, a chimp, and this President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that shuttle's going to make it, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President passes an Arab piling millions in cash onto his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit, Mister, the dignity and integrity of this presidency depends on the success of that mission.  And that's my last word!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
