dialogues.text: They both hang up and, making sure no one is watching, pi their noses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's our strategy on this one, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work for the people of these United States, Frank.  I have to do what's best for them. (grabs the red phone) Al, kill social security, cancel school lunches only for the poor, dismantle welfare, close all hospitals and public toilets, green light the MX-6, invade Brazil, and bring my horse around after my nap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted is at the controls.  Elaine rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon just ejected!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Elaine.  If this bomb trick works we just might make it.  Simon was a fool to eject now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right -- premature ejection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will happen to him, Ted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun will heat that thing to over 450 degrees within seconds.  He'll roast like a pig on a spit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a roast on a spit through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock on the time bomb TICKS down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at wristwatch) Are you afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not when I'm with you, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you'd have to be a fool not to be afraid at a time like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Gooch sucks on her cushion -- she's totally zonked o acid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at her hands) Are these my hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stella) Are you afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a nurse.  I can't afford to be afraid, Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Scraps) Are you afraid, Scraps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he BARKS once, subtitle translate) Now when there's a guy like Ted Striker up there, Jimmy. (he BARKS one more time -- subtitles) Now how about a little scratch on the inner thigh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testa stands over Ted with a clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty-six percent of the passengers are afraid.  Twenty-nine percent are not afraid.  Eight percent are undecided and seven percent think Israel should give back Finland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better strap yourself in, Testa. (on radio) Mission control, this is Mayflower.  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (V.O.) Go ahead, Striker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) We've got about 60 seconds before that thing blows.  We're set to reprogram for Mercury at zero point five WORP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROKSY (on radio) Zero point five WORP?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  When the bomb explodes we're going to have a ten foot hole in the fuselage and I want to get there as fast as I can.  I know what this snip can do, McCrosky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROKSY (to Controllers) No one's ever travelled at that speed before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last spring we did Europe in nine days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It careens towards the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bomb clock TICKS down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary instructs Passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads between the knees! (looking down aisle) Between your own knees, Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Flanagan looks around guiltily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCrosky addresses his troops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY I don't find it easy to talk at a time like this, but I want to say something about that guy up there.  I can sum it all up in one word -- courage, dedication, spirit, pride, selflessness, and g-u-t-s, guts.  Striker's got more guts in his little finger than most of us have in our large intestine.  He's got guts up to his eyeballs, guts coming out of his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Controllers start playing cards, doing needlepoint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Sure it's a cliche but great shortstops are born, not made, and a clown is funny in the circus but when he gets on the highway, he's murder.  It bugged me too when Mr. Ed refused to talk when the neighbors came over but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bomb TICKS down and BLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship shakes violently.  Ted fights for control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship starts bumping as if it's hit a rough road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) We've blown the computer! (to Elaine) Elaine!  Set course change!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flips a switch) Set!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushes a button) Compute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Compute" sign flashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted pulls an acceleration lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It slows to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted pulls the lever hard toward himself.  The ship shudde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship slingshots in the opposite direction, disappeari into the void leaving a trail of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Point five WORP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN Controllers looking intently into the night sky.  PAN Mrs. Salucci intently gripping her vibrator -- it's on. to Jacobs reading VARIETY -- headline: "PARAMOUNT ANNOUNC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Zero point five WORP, that's half the speed of light.  We really have no idea what can happen to the human body at that speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Passengers (contortionists) with legs up over their shoulders and looking out over their rear ends, play card

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior vibrates.  A psychedelic blaze of multi-colo light illuminates the interior.  Ted struggles with the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (V.O.) Striker, we're monitoring you.  You're right on course.  At that speed you should hit Mercury in about six minutes.  So give yourself enough time to kill those WORP engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY (on radio) We'll be out of radio range in a few seconds.  I'm going to put you in contact with Mercury Base Alpha Beta for your final descent.  Over. (off mike) Stinson, who's in command of Alpha Beta?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al Hammil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore.  It's Rex Kramer, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY Not Rex Kramer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Rex Kramer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the Alpha Beta base in distance with an ALPHA BETA neon sign flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four uniformed officers race to their posts around a corn and collide with four others racing around the corner fro the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REX KRAMER watches the floors flash by on the panel above the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.S. we hear a DOG GROWLING and fighting with something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this guy, Ted Striker.  I flew with him during the war.  He was a crack pilot but he didn't have it in the crunch... That is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until that day over Chicago.  He brought that busted up 767 out of that storm like a paper glider coming outta the baby blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But flying that shuttle is a whole different ballgame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open.  Kramer steps out into the communications room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN down to floor of elevator to find a young officer -- Carey -- torn to shreds and fighting off Kramer's golden retriever dog.  The doors close.  Kramer approaches an OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the latest, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll hit our atmosphere in about three minutes, if they hold together.  They've lost their computer and are coming in at zero point five WORP on manual control, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted shifts a stick shift on the steering column.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer looks at the big screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down scope!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A submarine periscope drops.  Kramer looks for the shuttl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll never bring that thing in on manual, but I guess Striker's their only hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his ship now.  He's the top dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big man.  The numero uno honcho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The head cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer steps away from the scope.  It drops down.  A man a barber chair is on the other end of the steel column an comes to rest on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we have radio contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testa talks to the passengers.  Psychedelic lights flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) We're travelling at one half the speed of light.  There is nothing to worry about. However, you might experience some temporary metabolic changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her beard grows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flurry of hands empties it in two seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has turned into a Hassidic Rabbi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted is fighting to maintain control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker, this is Rex Kramer on Alpha Beta. Do you read me?  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Elaine give startled looks of recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Ted.  Rex Kramer.  We've locked you on track beam.  You're going to have to kill those WORP engines in exactly thirty seconds.  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone tensely looks out the window into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKY There's nothing else we can do for those people out there now, except pray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire room explodes in an up-beat Southern Baptists' rendition of "HE'S GOT THE WHOLE WORLD IN HIS HANDS".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Striker!  Kill WORP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted pushes his WORP lever forward but it comes off in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, the lever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Kramer, the WORP control handle just came off in my hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try another handle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no more handles, only switches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No buttons?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around madly) Just switches, lights, and knobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at buttons and levers on his panel) I'd give my right arm to get just one of these buttons or levers up there right now. (on radio) Okay, Striker.  You're going to have to pull that lever panel off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Elaine) Screw driver!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a vodka and orange juice.  Ted throws it on his face.  He reaches down and rips the panel off, exposi all sorts of wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now find a piece of metal and stick it in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted looks around for a piece of metal.  Elaine pulls a bo pin from her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will this work, Ted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her long brown hair falls sexily.  She sweeps it back wit toss of her head.  Ted is overwhelmed by her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (on radio) I've got something that might work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bobby pin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer and Aids exchange a look which questions Ted's sexuality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is a man doing with a... forget it. (on radio) It'll have to do, Striker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted sticks the bobby pin into the wires.  Sparks fly.  Th ship starts slowing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer stands in front of the huge screen.  A small ship appears in the distance coming right at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Okay, Striker.  We have you on visual. Just keep her level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It careens towards the planet surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It starts bouncing wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's coming apart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The anchorman screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The anchorman screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER:  "EDITORIAL".  (In Russian looking print.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The desk clerk screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep her nose up!  Don't fight her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying but she's fighting me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boxing glove springs from the dash punching Ted in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, that's Alpha Beta!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the lights of a small colony on planet surface.  T Alpha Beta neon sign is visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer sits in a large swivel chair -- like Captain Kirk' on the Enterprise bridge.  As he talks, he nonchalantly swivels so his back is to the huge window.  We see the Mayflower approaching on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Now, Striker, there are a few things you have to keep in mind as you get close to the planet's atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch in horror as the Mayflower comes shooting at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) First and foremost you have to make one very important decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine looks out the window -- horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted!  We're not stopping!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted fights the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a landing you're sure you can make without endangering the lives of your passengers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run for cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayflower comes right at the screen and crashes throu it.  Kramer still has his back to the screen and doesn't notice what has happened -- the room behind him has been totally demolished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Now, once you've made that decision you have to be very clear about your responsibility to those people on that ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front window is broken.  Ted and Elaine are covered i debris.  Elaine's eyes grow wide with terror again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of scientists stand at a keyboard synthesizer.  O plays the series of notes from CLOSE ENCOUNTERS.  Suddenl the Mayflower appears over a hill.  They all jump for cov as it crashes through the synthesizer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Elaine are covered in piano keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their lives, their futures, their goals and aspirations are in your hands, Striker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayflower bounces across the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary maneuvers down the aisle.  Passengers are screaming being tossed around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to one passenger) Seat backs up.  Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up and sees feet dangling from the ceiling.  A has gone right through the ceiling up to his waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up) Sir, you really must take your seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) We're all with you on this one, Striker. Now get ready to position landing gear, cut engines, and fire your retroВ­rockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayflower careens to a smoking, crunching, shattering stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary and Testa start directing panic-striken passengers t the exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Timing's of the essence on a lame duck approach, Striker.  Don't fight her.  Hold her steady.  Nose up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Elaine stand looking down on the wreckage.  In b. SIRENS WAIL, emergency lights flash across Ted and Elaine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be all right!  Everyone's going to be okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted holds Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fight her, Striker.  Hold her!  Hold her!  Stay with her, Striker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Elaine kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, hit your landing gear and cut those engines!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Timing's everything, Striker!  Fire your retro-rockets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Elaine walk off into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice fading) Now give her full flap and keep that nose up.  Okay, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, what's going to happen to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted stops and looks into the distant, dark sky.  A printe crawl begins:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAR, FAR AWAY IN THE DEEPEST REGIONS OF OUR VAST SOLAR SYSTEM, A SMALL, BRAVE GROUP OF PIONEERS EMBARK ON A BOLD NEW ADVENTURE.  THEIR MISSION:  TO OPEN UP A NEW FRONTIER.  THEIR GOAL, TO BUILD A BRAVE NEW WORLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Elaine walk towards crawl and are approached by t strange CREATURES -- bald with a shock of hair sprouting from the top of their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, we'd like you to have this flower. We're with the Church of Mercurial Consciousness.  Would you like to make a donation?
